newsitem.title: USA: CNG chairman comfortable with '97 estimate.
newsitem.headline: CNG chairman comfortable with '97 estimate.

text.p: Consolidated Natural Gas Co Chairman George Davidson on Tuesday said he is comfortable with analysts' consensus estimates of $3.33 a share earnings this year.
"I'm comfortable with those numbers for the year," he told Reuters before the company's annual meeting here.

The company posted $171.5 million or $1.81 a share net income in the first quarter, down from a record $1.92 a share in the same period last year. Earnings in the 1997 period were dampened by mild winter weather, Davidson said.

Excluding the effects of the weather in both quarters and a workforce reduction charge in 1996, the company would have posted $1.94 a share earnings in the first quarter 1997, up from $1.82 in the same period last year, he said.
"I don't want to use that as an excuse, but I think the weather in the first quarter really masked the success that we've had," he said.
Davidson declined comment on analysts' First Call consensus estimates of $0.37 a share for the second quarter and $3.64 a share for 1998.
